title: 1976 NCAA Skiing Championships
text:
The 1976 <a href="NCAA%20Skiing%20Championships">NCAA Skiing Championships</a> were contested at <a href="Sunday%20River%20%28ski%20resort%29">Sunday River</a> ski area, near the town of <a href="Newry%2C%20Maine">Newry, Maine</a>, at the 23rd annual NCAA-sanctioned ski tournament to determine the individual and team national champions of men's collegiate <a href="alpine%20skiing">alpine</a>, <a href="Cross-country%20skiing%20%28sport%29">cross country skiing</a>, and <a href="ski%20jumping">ski jumping</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Four-time defending champion <a href="Colorado%20Buffaloes%20ski%20team">Colorado</a>, coached by alumnus <a href="Bill%20Marolt">Bill Marolt</a>, finished tied with <a href="Dartmouth%20Big%20Green%20ski%20team">Dartmouth</a>, coached by Jim Page, atop the team standings, with 112 points each, and shared the team national championship. Both teams finished a mere four points ahead of third-place <a href="Vermont%20Catamounts%20ski%20team">Vermont</a>; this was the seventh title for the Buffaloes and the second for the Big Green. 
Venue.
This year's championships were held March 3–6 in <a href="Maine">Maine</a> at Sunday River ski area in the town of <a href="Newry%2C%20Maine">Newry</a>. <a href="Bates%20College">Bates College</a> of <a href="Lewiston%2C%20Maine">Lewiston</a> served as host.
These were the second NCAA championships in Maine (<a href="1967%20NCAA%20Skiing%20Championships">1967</a>, <a href="Sugarloaf%20%28ski%20resort%29">Sugarloaf</a>) and eighth in the <a href="Eastern%20United%20States">East</a>, all in <a href="New%20England">New England</a>.
Individual events.
Four events were held, which yielded six individual titles.
